elements.name: question1
elements.title: What are the different types of sales prices?
elements.correctAnswer: A distinction is made between calculated, demand-oriented and competition-oriented sales prices.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What is predatory pricing and why is it used in retail businesses?
elements.correctAnswer: Predatory pricing is often below cost price. Retail businesses try to poach some of their customers or eliminate their competitors.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What is the point of a decoy price?
elements.correctAnswer: Long-term low prices on selected items are intended to lure customers into the store.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Why do retailers use psychological pricing?
elements.correctAnswer: Items with psychological prices appear to be "optically" cheaper than those with straight prices.
